fields.value: Replication Data for: Turkers of the World Unite: Multilevel In-Group Bias Amongst Crowdworkers On Amazon Mechanical Turk

dsDescriptionValue.value: This is the data we collected and code we used in our research that investigates the possibility that being a crowdworker on Amazon Mechanical Turk (MTurk) might be sufficient "social glue" to lead MTurk workers to form a social identity as a crowdworker, such that when they interact with other workers, they treat that interaction not as stranger-to-stranger, but rather as a within-group interaction with an ingroup member. Our main hypotheses, experimental design, and analyses were pre-registered before the collection of the data: http://aspredicted.org/blind.php?x=3dj5q5

publicationCitation.value: Almaatouq, Abdullah and Krafft, Peter and Dunham, Yarrow and Rand, David G. and Pentland, Alex, Turkers of the World Unite: Multilevel In-Group Bias Amongst Crowdworkers on Amazon Mechanical Turk (February 12, 2018). Available at SSRN: https://ssrn.com/abstract=3122520

files.description: This is the cleaned version of the data file and was used for all of the analyses.
files.label: data.csv

dataFile.description: This is the cleaned version of the data file and was used for all of the analyses.

files.description: This Jupyter Notebook takes the raw data file "qualtrics_UTF.csv" and produces the cleaned data file "data.csv" that is ready for analysis.
files.label: full_data_preparation.ipynb

dataFile.description: This Jupyter Notebook takes the raw data file "qualtrics_UTF.csv" and produces the cleaned data file "data.csv" that is ready for analysis.

files.description: This is the raw data as downloaded from qualtrics (the platform we used to get the contribution amount from the workers). It seems that by chance, two people got the same mTurkCode of '6885935', so we changed one manually to '6885936'. we also needed to fix the UTF format of the file using 'iconv -f utf-8 -t utf-8 -c qualtrics_raw.csv > qualtrics_UTF.csv' in the terminal.
files.label: qualtrics_UTF.tab

dataFile.description: This is the raw data as downloaded from qualtrics (the platform we used to get the contribution amount from the workers). It seems that by chance, two people got the same mTurkCode of '6885935', so we changed one manually to '6885936'. we also needed to fix the UTF format of the file using 'iconv -f utf-8 -t utf-8 -c qualtrics_raw.csv > qualtrics_UTF.csv' in the terminal.

files.description: This Jupyter Notebook reads the cleaned data from "data.csv" and conducts all of the primary analysis, across conditions comparisons, and compute p-values
